titles.title: Angolan Temporary Protected Status Act of 2003
To designate Angola under section 244 of the Immigration and Nationality Act in order to make nationals of Angola eligible for temporary protected status under such section.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration, Border Security, and Claims.

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 11/18/2003--Introduced. Angolan Temporary Protected Status Act of 2003 - Expresses the sense of Congress that Angola qualifies for designation under the Immigration and Nationality Act as a nation with an ongoing conflict pursuant to which Angolan nationals would be eligible for temporary protected status in the United States. Amends the Act to so designate Angola for an initial one-year period. Sets forth temporary protected status eligibility requirements for Angolan nationals.
